column4: How can I enable hardware accelerated 3D graphics support on Ubuntu 11.04 for an Intel graphics processor?
for intel, turn the computer on is all you should need.
That is not the case in this particular instance.  Do you have any troubleshooting suggestions?
not really... what's happening?  what are you trying to run that's failing?
from terminal does "glxinfo | grep direct" report Yes?
I believe there is a problem with some Nvidia driver moduel loading or something.
do you have an /etc/X11/xorg.conf?  you shouldn't, rename it to xorg.conf.OLD if you do.
The file is there but it is empty.
do you have nvidia packages installed?  "dpkg -l | grep nvidia" for a list.
Does that mean that it is installed?  If I look in synaptic package manager, it is not installed.
if dpkg says it's installed - it's installed.  you could use "sudo apt-get remove nvidia-current" to remove it (not sure that will help mind you)
sorry i don't have any other suggestions, good luck.
